intro: Strophanthus mirabilis, commonly known as the flame vine, is a striking tropical plant native to Africa. It is characterized by its long, pendulous clusters of bright orange-red flowers, which bloom throughout the year in warm climates. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap and toxic properties. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. The plant is widely cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
